track.name: Destroying Angels
comments: destroy them with the bass and, smooth horn and that metal brush.
absolutely beautiful, best song on the album
This song is what life is about on those quiet afternoons and nights.

Probably the most accessible track from such a dark album, but it's maybe one of the best jazz tracks that manages to be both smooth and doom-sounding. The keys and drums are solid, but the bass is good and the sax is....monumental.
Damn.  There really are no words....
very sensual and dark ,my favorite too.
I imagine a serial killer seducing and killing some angelic woman. Probably during the 1930s or 40s, in the city, during the night. Also my favorite Bohren track.
So very good... In any situation, it changes my mood in an instant.
or "the next piece we'll be playing is about destroying angels piece by piece with your hands"
"the next piece we'll be playing is about angels destroying everything it's called: destroying angels"
title fits the song perfectly. almost too perfectly. don't find that too often
Makes me want to have a cigarette in a room with suffused lights...
When that bass slides, my universe collapses.
